subject: Personal Finance
title: Annuities Explained
description: A quick, practical guide to Annuities Explained.

hook.text: An annuity converts a lump sum into guaranteed monthly income. It's buying yourself a pension.

buildup.text: Insurance companies sell annuities. You give them money now; they pay you a fixed amount for life.

discovery.text: The guarantee protects against outliving your savings â€” the biggest risk in retirement.

twist.text: Annuities are often expensive, complex, and loaded with fees. The insurance company profits handsomely.

climax.text: Simple, low-cost annuities can be valuable for a portion of retirement income. Complex ones usually aren't.

punchline.text: Annuities: great concept, often bad product.

quiz.question: What risk do annuities protect against?
